co: Understand the basic concepts of programming, including variables, data types, and control structures.
po: Apply knowledge of mathematics and computing fundamentals.

CO: Understand the basic concepts of programming, including variables, data types, and control structures.
PO: Apply knowledge of mathematics and computing fundamentals.
questions: Understand the basic concepts of programming, including variables, data types, and control structures.
What types of data can variables store, and what are the unique names given to them called?
What determines what kind of data a variable can hold?
What are control structures and what do they allow programs to do?
Differentiate between variables and data types in programming, providing examples and counter-examples to clarify the distinction.
Describe the concept of control structures in a way that promotes understanding and engagement.
Identify potential issues related to variables, data types, or control structures that may be causing a problem in a program.
Evaluate the strengths and weaknesses of different data types in a programming language, and provide recommendations for when to use each type.
Design a simple program that uses variables, data types, and control structures to simulate a real-world scenario.
Compare and contrast the use of variables and control structures in programming, and provide examples of when each is most appropriate.
How do you declare an array?
Which of the following is a linear data structure? (A) Tree (B) Graph (C) Stack (D) Heap
What is the time complexity of binary search? (A) O(n) (B) O(log n) (C) O(n^2) (D) O(1)
Which sorting algorithm has the best average case? (A) Bubble Sort (B) Quick Sort (C) Selection Sort (D) Insertion Sort
What is polymorphism? (A) Multiple forms (B) Single form (C) No form (D) Abstract form
